image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with the Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flags.

props.synopsis: A man accused of removing a condom during an encounter with a sex worker is facing trial for stealthing, which amounts to a sexual assault under the law because it negates consent.

title.children: Man accused of stealthing during encounter with Canberra sex worker

image.altText: Alexander Maconochie Centre is Canberra's only prison.

props.synopsis: Police are investigating the death of a 38-year-old Aboriginal man who he suffered a fatal "medical episode" in Canberra's only prison just four days after a 73-year-old Aboriginal man died at the same jail while on remand.

title.children: Second Aboriginal detainee in four days dies in Canberra prison

image.altText: Breeding facility bringing smoky mice back from the brink

props.synopsis: Smoky mouse populations are so isolated and in such low numbers that the animals struggle to find mates that are not genetically related to them. However, a Canberra program is helping to change that.

title.children: Native mouse struggling to breed gets helping hand in ACT

image.altText: Three people lie in adjacent sections of a bus that each have a mattress in them.

props.synopsis: Fundraisers feel ripped off after backing the Sleepbus charity that they thought would deliver buses and give homeless people a decent night's sleep.

title.children: Project to give homeless a safe sleeping space running out of money

image.altText: 'Welcome to Genius Gungahlin' sign on a building.

props.synopsis: Genius Childcare centre in Gungahlin will be temporarily shut down by the ACT regulator after it received a spate of reports about child health and safety breaches.

title.children: Canberra childcare temporarily shut 'in the best interest of children'

image.altText: a man does a trick on a skateboard

props.synopsis: Skateboarders from across the country — and around the world — spent their weekend at the Belco Bowl Jam where a new, world-class vert ramp took the competition to a higher level.

title.children: Skateboarders from across the world show off 'gnarly tricks' at Canberra comp

image.altText: A large housing construction site with multiple excavators on the edge of a bush block.

props.synopsis: The second stage of Canberra suburb Denman Prospect was set to be built on Bluetts Block in the Molonglo Valley, but it has now been declared a nature reserve to preserve its ecological value.

title.children: 'Lovely piece of bushland' at Canberra's edge spared from development

image.altText: A bird's head pokes out from a wrapped towel.

props.synopsis: Community volunteers have set up a hospital in a country New South Wales showground to triage and treat hundreds of birds injured during a hailstorm earlier this week.

title.children: Town goes quiet as hundreds of birds killed or injured in hailstorm

image.altText: A young woman in a gym wearing blue bike pants and crop top, lunging with a weighted bag on her back.

props.synopsis: Thousands of social media followers are trying out the hybrid training model, but experts say the intense training style can be harmful, if not done correctly.

title.children: Hyrox training is trending on social media, but it's not new in the gym

image.altText: Birdseye view of a young girl drawing at a table.

props.synopsis: National test results show just 28 per cent of Year 10 students are proficient in civics.

title.children: Call for 'immediate overhaul' of curriculum after 'shocking' civics results

image.altText: Group of city workers walking on street

props.synopsis: After more than six months of on-again off-again signals, interest rates are about to start a descent. But even with inflation on the mend, the cost-of-living crisis is nowhere near being solved.

title.children: Why the Reserve Bank has little option but to cut interest rates

image.altText: A group of people wearing black, their faces covered. They are crouching in front of a wall with the word Hitler on it.

props.synopsis: Experts and families are warning that the current system to intervene and rehabilitate people who have joined extremist groups is flawed.

title.children: Police-led approach to stopping extremism risks community safety, experts say

image.altText: A man holds a woman's head and kisses her.

props.synopsis: A Foreign Correspondent investigation has detailed the decades of sexism and misogyny leading up to the infamous World Cup kiss.

title.children: Infamous World Cup kiss blew lid on open secret in women's football

image.altText: Jenkins looks directly at the camera sadly wearing camo gear and a hoodie

props.synopsis: The short video was posted to YouTube just over a week ago and shows the 32-year-old Australian dressed in green army fatigues.

title.children: 'I would like more freedom': New video of Oscar Jenkins emerges

image.altText: Pippa Buchanan shows the battery that lives in her shed.

props.synopsis: Households are handing over control of their solar systems in exchange for equipment. Experts believe virtual power plants could play a vital part in our future energy system as the grid struggles to cope with excess solar.

title.children: Households slash power bills by turning into modern power plants

image.altText: Peter Dutton and Anthony Albanese's faces are overlaid onto a blue and red pie graph. Logos of social media companies present

props.synopsis: The election has not been been called yet but the battle for votes on social media is already well underway. So which party is ahead?

title.children: Dutton and the Liberals winning the battle for attention on TikTok

image.altText: Gas leak at Nord Stream 2 as seen from the Danish F-16 interceptor.

props.synopsis: Experts say the use of sabotage as a weapon of war could become more common, after a spike in mysterious incidents across Europe since the beginning of the Ukraine War.

title.children: 'Brave new world' in warfare due to snapped cables, putting Australia at risk

image.altText: An image of street lights in Dili, Timor-Leste.

props.synopsis: A high-stakes legal battle spanning nearly a decade sees Australian energy company Lighthouse Corporation suing Timor-Leste for $523 million, while the nation hits back with explosive fraud allegations.

title.children: Timor-Leste calls $523m Australian lawsuit 'major fraud'

image.altText: A woman with long hair, smiling.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's proposed trade tariffs on Canada are on pause but, should the US president reinstate them, Canada's trade minister warns the US will pay.

title.children: 'Respond with impact': Canadian trade minister issues Trump tariff warning

image.altText: Pope Francis sitting on a white chair during a service.

props.synopsis: The Vatican says the pontiff will remain in hospital "as long as needed" as he battles a respiratory tract infection.

title.children: Pope Francis to stay in hospital amid 'complex clinical situation'

image.altText: Media Mogul Rupert Murdoch poses for a photograph with his sons Lachlan  and James at his wedding in 2016.

props.synopsis: Thousands of pages of court documents and an exclusive interview reveal details of the Murdoch family trust court case.

title.children: 'You've blown a hole in the family': Inside the Murdoch Project Family Harmony trial

image.altText: Shane Patton is well-lit in a side profile photograph against a dark backdrdop.

props.synopsis: After a whirlwind of headlines saw the state's top cop vacate the chair, Victorians might be asking themselves: did Jacinta Allan's government throw Shane Patton under the bus?

title.children: Questions still linger over exit of Victoria's top cop

image.altText: Person displays something in their hand.

props.synopsis: Something has washed up on a Tasmanian beach over the weekend. The Bob Brown Foundation has sounded alarm bells but the salmon farming company it is targeting is reassuring locals there is nothing to worry about.

title.children: Bob Brown Foundation and Huon salmon at odds over 'material' washed up on beach

image.altText: firefighter holds hose sending water up into trees that are on fire.

props.synopsis: Aerial support had to be pulled during Sunday's bushfire in Dunsborough after rogue drones were spotted in the area.

title.children: Drones ground water bombers during another WA bushfire

image.altText: GFX 5 Tasmania North West fires

props.synopsis: The bushfires on Tasmania's west coast have now burned nearly 95,000 hectares in hard-to-access terrain. Here's how that compares to the devastating fires of 2018-19 — and what comes next.

title.children: Tasmania's growing bushfires cover area larger than Hobart

props.synopsis: Around-the-clock coverage of news events as they break, at home and abroad.

title.children: Watch: News Channel

image.altText: A man dressed in hospital scrubs and a bandanna holds a baby which has its face blurred.

props.synopsis: A court hears a prominent Perth obstetrician was allegedly crying, driving erratically and had been drinking before his Jaguar slammed into a Honda, killing a young woman.

title.children: Perth obstetrician speeding and drunk before fatal Dalkeith crash, court hears

image.altText: Lauren Willgoose walks alongside an older woman outside the court

props.synopsis: Lauren Jean Willgoose has asked a court to be sentenced to home detention for causing the crash which killed prominent neuropsychologist Anthony Walsh, because she would be "devastated" to be separated from her young son if she is jailed. Prosecutor Michael Foundas described her pregnancy as a "reckless decision".

title.children: Lawyer made 'reckless decision' to get pregnant while awaiting sentence

image.altText: Composite image of six victims of jumping castle tragedy with school signage as background

props.synopsis: A lawyer representing the operator of a jumping castle that flew into the air resulting in six students dying in 2021 calls on a judge to make "very adverse findings" against the Chinese manufacturer of the inflatable device.

title.children: Chinese maker of jumping castle at fault, lawyer argues

image.altText: A man standing and speaking, while a young boy next to him picks his nose, and another man sits behind a desk

props.synopsis: The Trump administration has halted the firing of hundreds of workers in nuclear weapons programs, with experts warning a new agency aimed at cutting cost will put communities at risk.

title.children: Trump administration tries to rehire fired nuclear weapons workers

image.altText: A shark with sharp teeth and mesh in its mouth.

props.synopsis: A fishing crew says it can't believe not one, but three, great white sharks approached its boat during a game fishing competition in waters north of Newcastle.

title.children: Fisherman describes encounter with three great white sharks

image.altText: Bruising on Elaf's arm and leg in the aftermath of the incident.

props.synopsis: A childcare worker is afraid to leave her home alone after being one of two women attacked at Epping Plaza, prompting advocacy groups to call for immediate action amid a rise in Islamophobic incidents.

title.children: 'Don't feel safe': Two women attacked at shopping centre as Islamophobia spikes

image.altText: A man standing in front of a blue painting smiles gently

props.synopsis: Tony Burke says he was unaware of Khaled Sabsabi's earlier works showing Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah, ahead of his being chosen for the Venice Biennale.

title.children: 'Not briefed': Tony Burke on Venice Biennale controversy

image.altText: Coogee local Erik de Haart stands in front of a memorial commemorating the bali bombing victims in coogee

props.synopsis: Mr de Haart pulled victims from the wreckage of Bali's Sari Club after bombs orchestrated by terrorist groups exploded, killing 202.

title.children: Bali bombings survivor, Sydney man Erik de Haart dies aged 67

image.altText: Jannik Sinner sits courtside with his hands together under his chin after losing the China Open. The net is in the foreground.

props.synopsis: Athletes and legal experts are speaking out about the apparent double standards at play in the decision to ban world number one Jannik Sinner for three months in between tennis grand slams.

title.children: Shayna Jack's lawyer takes aim at WADA over 'perplexing' Sinner ban
